summary: all students in grades 7, 8 and 9 are to receive the pertussis vaccine. a similar school vaccination program was instituted across the province at the end of the last school year. by early September 2012, the province's cases numbered more than 1100. it is expected that the vaccination will be provided by around 600 pharmacies for the 2012–13 season. the provincial government has said it hopes that providing flu vaccination in pharmacies will boost the Ontario flu vaccination rate from its current 33% level to at least 50%. the government hasn't yet reached agreement on reimbursement for other aspects of the expanded authority. the infections were linked to tainted batches of an injectable steroid. three lots of the drug methylprednisolone acetate were contaminated by a fungus. the specialty pharmacy stopped operations and recalled the medication as a precaution.
